title: Ticket #603: Break CONFIG permission into CONFIG and STORECRED
description: The CONFIG security level allows use of "condor_config_val -set" as well as "condor_store_cred -c". It's not possible to distinguish between the two. An admin might want to limit "condor_store_cred -c" to himself while letting users change START using cnodor_config_val -set. (See the associated Rust ticket for an actual example). These two permissions are distinct and should be represented with distinct security levels.
